fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Employment and Social Affairs, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Climate Action, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: The mains dossiers which the NVB is following in Brussels are the Risk Reduction Package, Capital Markets Union initiatives, the Fintech agenda and the Retail Financial Services Action Plan.
organisation_name: Nederlandse Vereniging van Banken / Dutch Banking Association (NVB)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
European Banking Federation: www.ebf.eu

goals__remit:
The Nederlandse Vereniging van Banken (NVB - Dutch Banking Association) was founded in 1989. The NVB is the representative voice of the Dutch banking community with around 65 members, large and small, domestic and international banks. At the European level the Association is a member of the European Banking Federation and has a Brussels office to represent the Dutch banking sector in the European policy formation and legislative processes. The NVB works towards a service-oriented, sustainable and internationally competitive banking industry. 
 
 
More information: 
www.nvb.nl
relevant_communication: The Netherlandse Vereniging van Banken is closely monitoring the implementation of regulation, i.e. Level II measures.
